00001 /*********************************************************************************
00002 * SGP Digital Sound Module

00004 *           This module handles the playing of digital samples, preloaded or streamed.
00005 * 
00006 * Derek Beland, May 28, 1997
00007 *
00008 *********************************************************************************/

00128 // Struct definition for sample slots in the cache
00129 //          Holds the regular sample data, as well as the
00130 //          data for the random samples
00131 
00132 typedef struct {
00133                         CHAR8       pName[128];                               // Sample path
00134                         UINT32            uiSize;                                         // Sample size
00135                         UINT32            uiFlags;                                  // Status flags
00136                         PTR               pData;                                          // Pointer to loaded sample
00137                         UINT32            uiCacheHits;                    // Cache hits for this sample
00138 
00139                         UINT32            uiTimeNext;                               // Random sound data
00140                         UINT32            uiTimeMin, uiTimeMax;
00141                         UINT32            uiVolMin, uiVolMax;
00142                         UINT32            uiPanMin, uiPanMax;
00143                         UINT32            uiPriority;                     // Priority
00144                         UINT32            uiInstances;                    // Instances of sample sounding at this moment
00145                         UINT32            uiMaxInstances;                 // Max allowable instances of sample
00146                         } SAMPLETAG;
00147 
00148 // Structure definition for slots in the sound output
00149 //          These are used for both the cached and double-buffered
00150 //          streams
00151 typedef struct {
00152                         UINT32                  uiSample;       // Sample slot in cache
00153                         FSOUND_STREAM*    hStream;        // Stream fmod handler
00154                         UINT32                uiFMODChannel;  // Fmod channel
00155                         UINT32                  uiFlags;        // Sample flags
00156                         UINT32                  uiSoundID;      // Sound unique ID
00157                         UINT32                  uiPriority;     // Priority
00158                         void              (*EOSCallback)(void *);
00159                         void              *pCallbackData;
00160                         UINT32                  uiTimeStamp;    // Time stamp
00161                         BOOLEAN                 fLooping;       // Loop flag
00162                         BOOLEAN                 fStopAtZero;    // Stop at zero volume
00163                         UINT32                  uiFadeVolume;
00164                         UINT32                  uiFadeRate;
00165                         UINT32                  uiFadeTime;
00166                         } SOUNDTAG;
00167 
00168 // Sample cache list for files loaded
00169 SAMPLETAG   pSampleList[SOUND_MAX_CACHED];                                                
00170 // Sound channel list for output channels
00171 SOUNDTAG    pSoundList[SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS];

00187       gfEnableStartup=fEnable;

00190 //*******************************************************************************
00191 // SoundGetDriverHandle
00192 //
00193 //    Returns:    Pointer to the system level output device module.
00194 //
00195 //*******************************************************************************
00196 void *SoundGetDriverHandle( void )
00197 {
00198     if(fSoundSystemInit)
00199         return(FSOUND_GetOutputHandle());
00200     else
00201         return(NULL);
00202 }

00204 //*******************************************************************************
00205 // InitializeSoundManager
00206 //
00207 //    Zeros out the structs for the system info, and initializes the cache.
00208 //
00209 //    Returns:    TRUE always
00210 //
00211 //*******************************************************************************
00212 BOOLEAN InitializeSoundManager(void)
00213 {
00214     UINT32 uiCount;
00215 
00216     InitLogging();
00217 
00218       if(fSoundSystemInit)
00219     {
00220         SoundLog("Reopening JA2 sound manager");
00221             ShutdownSoundManager();
00222     }
00223     else
00224         SoundLog("Initialising JA2 sound manager");
00225     
00226     SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  Using %d channels", SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS));
00227 
00228       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS; uiCount++)
00229     {
00230             memset(&pSoundList[uiCount], 0, sizeof(SOUNDTAG));
00231     }
00232 
00233     // Setup callbacks
00234     FSOUND_File_SetCallbacks(SoundFileOpen, SoundFileClose, SoundFileRead, SoundFileSeek, SoundFileTell);
00235 
00236 #ifndef SOUND_DISABLE
00237       if(gfEnableStartup && SoundInitHardware())
00238             fSoundSystemInit=TRUE;
00239 #endif
00240 
00241       SoundInitCache();
00242 
00243     SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  Sound memory limit = %i", SOUND_DEFAULT_MEMORY));
00244     SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  Cache threshold = %i", SOUND_DEFAULT_THRESH));
00245 
00246       guiSoundMemoryLimit=SOUND_DEFAULT_MEMORY;
00247       guiSoundMemoryUsed=0;
00248       guiSoundCacheThreshold=SOUND_DEFAULT_THRESH;
00249 
00250       return(TRUE);
00251 }
00252 
00253 //*******************************************************************************
00254 // ShutdownSoundManager
00255 //
00256 //          Silences all currently playing sound, deallocates any memory allocated,
00257 //    and releases the sound hardware.
00258 //
00259 //*******************************************************************************
00260 void ShutdownSoundManager(void)
00261 {
00262     SoundLog("Closing sound system...");
00263 
00264       SoundStopAll();
00265       SoundShutdownCache();
00266       Sleep(1000);
00267       SoundShutdownHardware();
00268       fSoundSystemInit=FALSE;
00269     SoundLog("JA2 sound manager shutdown");
00270 }
00271 
00272 //*******************************************************************************
00273 // SoundPlay
00274 //
00275 //          Starts a sample playing. If the sample is not loaded in the cache, it will    
00276 //    be found and loaded. The pParms structure is used to
00277 //    override the attributes of the sample such as playback speed, and to specify
00278 //    a volume. Any entry containing SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT will be set by the system.
00279 //
00280 //    Returns:    If the sound was started, it returns a sound ID unique to that
00281 //                                  instance of the sound
00282 //                                  If an error occured, SOUND_ERROR will be returned
00283 //
00284 //
00285 //    !!Note:  Can no longer play streamed files
00286 //
00287 //*******************************************************************************
00288 
00289 UINT32 SoundPlay(STR pFilename, SOUNDPARMS *pParms)
00290 {
00291       UINT32 uiSample, uiChannel;
00292 
00293       if( fSoundSystemInit )
00294       {
00295             if( !SoundPlayStreamed(pFilename) )
00296             {
00297                   if((uiSample=SoundLoadSample(pFilename))!=NO_SAMPLE)
00298                   {
00299                         if((uiChannel=SoundGetFreeChannel())!=SOUND_ERROR)
00300                         {
00301                               return(SoundStartSample(uiSample, uiChannel, pParms));
00302                         }
00303                   }
00304             }
00305             else
00306             {
00307                   //Trying to play a sound which is bigger then the 'guiSoundCacheThreshold'
00308                   FastDebugMsg(String("SoundPlay: ERROR: Trying to play %s sound is too lardge to load into cache, use SoundPlayStreamedFile() instead\n", pFilename ) );
00309             }
00310       }
00311 
00312       return(SOUND_ERROR);
00313 }
00314 
00315 
00316 //*******************************************************************************
00317 // SoundPlayStreamedFile
00318 //
00319 //          The sample will
00320 //    be played as a double-buffered sample. The pParms structure is used to
00321 //    override the attributes of the sample such as playback speed, and to specify
00322 //    a volume. Any entry containing SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT will be set by the system.
00323 //
00324 //    Returns:    If the sound was started, it returns a sound ID unique to that
00325 //                                  instance of the sound
00326 //                                  If an error occured, SOUND_ERROR will be returned
00327 //
00328 //*******************************************************************************
00329 UINT32      SoundPlayStreamedFile( STR pFilename, SOUNDPARMS *pParms )
00330 {
00331       UINT32      uiChannel;
00332       HWFILE      hFile;
00333 
00334       if( fSoundSystemInit )
00335       {
00336             if((uiChannel=SoundGetFreeChannel())!=SOUND_ERROR)
00337             {
00338                   hFile = FileOpen( pFilename, FILE_ACCESS_READ | FILE_OPEN_EXISTING, FALSE );
00339                   if( !hFile )
00340                   {
00341                         SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  ERROR in SoundPlayStreamedFile():  Couldnt open '%s'", pFilename ) );
00342                         return( SOUND_ERROR );
00343                   }
00344 
00345                   FileClose(hFile);
00346                   return(SoundStartStream( pFilename, uiChannel, pParms));
00347             }
00348       }
00349       return(SOUND_ERROR);
00350 }
00351 
00352 //*******************************************************************************
00353 // SoundPlayRandom
00354 //
00355 //          Registers a sample to be played randomly within the specified parameters.
00356 //    Parameters are passed in through pParms. Any parameter containing
00357 //    SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT will be set by the system. Only the uiTimeMin entry may
00358 //    NOT be defaulted. 
00359 //
00360 //    * Samples designated "random" are ALWAYS loaded into the cache, and locked
00361 //    in place. They are never double-buffered, and this call will fail if they
00362 //    cannot be loaded. *
00363 //
00364 //    Returns:    If successful, it returns the sample index it is loaded to, else
00365 //                                  SOUND_ERROR is returned.
00366 //
00367 //*******************************************************************************
00368 UINT32 SoundPlayRandom(STR pFilename, RANDOMPARMS *pParms)
00369 {
00370       UINT32 uiSample;
00371       
00372       if(fSoundSystemInit)
00373       {
00374             if((uiSample=SoundLoadSample(pFilename))!=NO_SAMPLE)
00375             {
00376                   // Sample loaded - marking slot
00377                   pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags|=(SAMPLE_RANDOM|SAMPLE_LOCKED);
00378                   
00379                   // Setup time intervals
00380                   if(pParms->uiTimeMin==SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT)
00381                         return(SOUND_ERROR);
00382                   else
00383                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeMin=pParms->uiTimeMin;
00384 
00385                   if(pParms->uiTimeMax==SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT)
00386                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeMax=pParms->uiTimeMin;
00387                   else
00388                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeMax=pParms->uiTimeMax;
00389 
00390                   // Volume
00391                   if(pParms->uiVolMin==SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT)
00392                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiVolMin=guiSoundDefaultVolume;
00393                   else
00394                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiVolMin=pParms->uiVolMin;
00395 
00396                   if(pParms->uiVolMax==SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT)
00397                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiVolMax=guiSoundDefaultVolume;
00398                   else
00399                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiVolMax=pParms->uiVolMax;
00400 
00401                   // Panning
00402                   if(pParms->uiPanMin==SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT)
00403             {
00404                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiPanMin=128;
00405                 pSampleList[uiSample].uiPanMax=128;
00406             }
00407                   else
00408             {
00409                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiPanMin=pParms->uiPanMin;
00410                 pSampleList[uiSample].uiPanMax=pParms->uiPanMax;
00411             }
00412 
00413                   // Max instances
00414                   if(pParms->uiMaxInstances==SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT)
00415                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiMaxInstances=1;
00416                   else
00417                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiMaxInstances=pParms->uiMaxInstances;
00418 
00419                   // Priority
00420                   if(pParms->uiPriority==SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT)
00421                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiPriority=PRIORITY_RANDOM;
00422                   else
00423                         pSampleList[uiSample].uiPriority=pParms->uiPriority;
00424 
00425                   pSampleList[uiSample].uiInstances=0;
00426 
00427                   // Time stamp
00428                   pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeNext=GetTickCount()+pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeMin+Random(pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeMax-pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeMin);
00429                   
00430                   return(uiSample);
00431             }
00432         else
00433         {
00434             SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  ERROR in SoundPlayRandom():  Couldnt open '%s'", pFilename ) );
00435         }
00436       }
00437 
00438       return(SOUND_ERROR);
00439 }

00441 //*******************************************************************************
00442 // SoundIsPlaying
00443 //
00444 //          Returns TRUE/FALSE that an instance of a sound is still playing.
00445 //
00446 //*******************************************************************************
00447 BOOLEAN SoundIsPlaying(UINT32 uiSoundID)
00448 {
00449 UINT32 uiSound;
00450 
00451       if(fSoundSystemInit)
00452       {
00453             uiSound=SoundGetIndexByID(uiSoundID);
00454             if(uiSound!=NO_SAMPLE)
00455         {
00456             return(SoundIndexIsPlaying(uiSound));
00457         }
00458       }
00459 
00460       return(FALSE);
00461 }
00462 
00463 //*****************************************************************************************
00464 // SoundIndexIsPlaying
00465 // 
00466 // Returns TRUE/FALSE whether a sound channel's sample is currently playing.
00467 // 
00468 // Returns BOOLEAN            - TRUE = playing, FALSE = stopped or nothing allocated
00469 // 
00470 // UINT32 uiSound             - Channel number of sound
00471 //
00472 // Created:  2/24/00 Derek Beland
00473 //*****************************************************************************************
00474 BOOLEAN SoundIndexIsPlaying(UINT32 uiSound)
00475 {
00476       if(fSoundSystemInit)
00477       {
00478             if( pSoundList[uiSound].hStream!=NULL )
00479             return(FSOUND_IsPlaying(pSoundList[uiSound].uiFMODChannel));
00480       }
00481 
00482       return(FALSE);
00483 }
00484 
00485 //*******************************************************************************
00486 // SoundStop
00487 //
00488 //          Stops the playing of a sound instance, if still playing.
00489 //
00490 //    Returns:    TRUE if the sample was actually stopped, FALSE if it could not be
00491 //                                  found, or was not playing.
00492 //
00493 //*******************************************************************************
00494 BOOLEAN SoundStop(UINT32 uiSoundID)
00495 {
00496 UINT32 uiSound;
00497       
00498       if(fSoundSystemInit)
00499       {
00500             if(SoundIsPlaying(uiSoundID))
00501             {
00502                   uiSound=SoundGetIndexByID(uiSoundID);
00503                   if(uiSound!=NO_SAMPLE)
00504                   {
00505                         SoundStopIndex(uiSound);
00506                         return(TRUE);
00507                   }
00508             }
00509       }
00510 
00511       return(FALSE);
00512 }
00513 
00514 //*******************************************************************************
00515 // SoundSetMemoryLimit
00516 //
00517 //          Specifies how much memory the sound system is allowed to dynamically 
00518 // allocate. Once this limit is reached, the cache code will start dropping the
00519 // least-used samples. You should always set the limit higher by a good margin
00520 // than your actual memory requirements, to give the cache some elbow room.
00521 //
00522 //    Returns:    TRUE if the limit was set, or FALSE if the memory already used is
00523 //                                  greater than the limit requested.
00524 //
00525 //*******************************************************************************
00526 BOOLEAN SoundSetMemoryLimit(UINT32 uiLimit)
00527 {
00528       if(guiSoundMemoryLimit < guiSoundMemoryUsed)
00529             return(FALSE);
00530 
00531       guiSoundMemoryLimit=uiLimit;
00532       return(TRUE);
00533 }
00534

00581 //*******************************************************************************
00582 // SoundStopAll
00583 //
00584 //          Stops all currently playing sounds.
00585 //
00586 //    Returns:    TRUE, always
00587 //
00588 //*******************************************************************************
00589 BOOLEAN SoundStopAll(void)
00590 {
00591 UINT32 uiCount;
00592 
00593     SoundLog("  Stopping all sounds");
00594 
00595       if(fSoundSystemInit)
00596       {
00597             for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS; uiCount++)
00598                         SoundStopIndex(uiCount);
00599       }
00600       
00601       return(TRUE);
00602 }

00605 //*******************************************************************************
00606 // SoundSetVolume
00607 //
00608 //          Sets the volume on a currently playing sound. 
00609 //
00610 //    Returns:    TRUE if the volume was actually set on the sample, FALSE if the
00611 //                                  sample had already expired or couldn't be found
00612 //
00613 //*******************************************************************************
00614 BOOLEAN SoundSetVolume(UINT32 uiSoundID, UINT32 uiVolume)
00615 {
00616 UINT32 uiSound, uiVolCap;
00617 
00618     if(fSoundSystemInit)
00619       {
00620         uiVolCap=__min(uiVolume, MAX_VOLUME);
00621             
00622             if((uiSound=SoundGetIndexByID(uiSoundID))!=NO_SAMPLE)
00623             {
00624                   pSoundList[uiSound].uiFadeVolume = uiVolume;
00625             return(SoundSetVolumeIndex(uiSound, uiVolume));
00626             }
00627       }
00628       
00629     return(FALSE);
00630 }
00631 
00632 
00633 //*****************************************************************************************
00634 // SoundSetVolumeIndex
00635 // 
00636 // Sounds the volume on a sound channel.
00637 // 
00638 // Returns BOOLEAN            - TRUE if the volume was set
00639 // 
00640 // UINT32 uiChannel           - Sound channel   
00641 // UINT32 uiVolume            - New volume 0-127
00642 //
00643 // Created:  3/17/00 Derek Beland
00644 //*****************************************************************************************
00645 BOOLEAN SoundSetVolumeIndex(UINT32 uiChannel, UINT32 uiVolume)
00646 {
00647 UINT32 uiVolCap;
00648 
00649       if(fSoundSystemInit)
00650       {
00651         uiVolCap=__min(uiVolume, MAX_VOLUME);
00652             
00653             if( pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream!=NULL )
00654             FSOUND_SetVolume(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel, uiVolCap * 2);
00655 
00656         return(TRUE);
00657       }
00658 
00659       return(FALSE);
00660 }
00661 
00662 //*******************************************************************************
00663 // SoundSetPan
00664 //
00665 //          Sets the pan on a currently playing sound. 
00666 //
00667 //    Returns:    TRUE if the pan was actually set on the sample, FALSE if the
00668 //                                  sample had already expired or couldn't be found
00669 //
00670 //*******************************************************************************
00671 BOOLEAN SoundSetPan(UINT32 uiSoundID, UINT32 uiPan)
00672 {
00673 UINT32 uiSound, uiPanCap;
00674 
00675       if(fSoundSystemInit)
00676       {
00677             uiPanCap=__min(uiPan, 255);               
00678             
00679             if((uiSound=SoundGetIndexByID(uiSoundID))!=NO_SAMPLE)
00680             {
00681                   if( pSoundList[uiSound].hStream!=NULL )
00682                         FSOUND_SetPan(pSoundList[uiSound].uiFMODChannel, uiPanCap);
00683 
00684                   return(TRUE);
00685             }
00686       }
00687 
00688       return(FALSE);
00689 }

00692 //*******************************************************************************

00694 //
00695 //          Returns the current volume setting of a sound that is playing. If the sound
00696 //    has expired, or could not be found, SOUND_ERROR is returned.
00697 //
00698 //*******************************************************************************
00699 UINT32 SoundGetVolume(UINT32 uiSoundID)
00700 {
00701 UINT32 uiSound;
00702 
00703       if(fSoundSystemInit)
00704       {
00705             if((uiSound=SoundGetIndexByID(uiSoundID))!=NO_SAMPLE)
00706                   return(SoundGetVolumeIndex(uiSound));
00707       }
00708 
00709       return(SOUND_ERROR);
00710 }

00712 
00713 //*****************************************************************************************
00714 // SoundGetVolumeIndex
00715 // 
00716 // Returns the current volume of a sound channel.
00717 // 
00718 // Returns UINT32             - Volume 0-127
00719 // 
00720 // UINT32 uiChannel           - Channel
00721 //
00722 // Created:  3/17/00 Derek Beland
00723 //*****************************************************************************************
00724 UINT32 SoundGetVolumeIndex(UINT32 uiChannel)
00725 {
00726     if(fSoundSystemInit)
00727       {
00728             if( pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream!=NULL )
00729                   return((UINT32)FSOUND_GetVolume(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel) / 2);
00730       }
00731 
00732       return(SOUND_ERROR);
00733 }
00734 
00735 //*******************************************************************************
00736 // SoundServiceRandom
00737 //
00738 //          This function should be polled by the application if random samples are
00739 //    used. The time marks on each are checked and if it is time to spawn a new
00740 //    instance of the sound, the number already in existance are checked, and if
00741 //    there is room, a new one is made and the count updated. 
00742 //          If random samples are not being used, there is no purpose in polling this
00743 //    function.
00744 // 
00745 //    Returns:    TRUE if a new random sound was created, FALSE if nothing was done.
00746 //
00747 //*******************************************************************************
00748 BOOLEAN SoundServiceRandom(void)
00749 {
00750 UINT32 uiCount;
00751 BOOLEAN fRandomSoundWasCreated=FALSE;
00752 
00753     for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CACHED; uiCount++)
00754       {
00755             if(!(pSampleList[uiCount].uiFlags&SAMPLE_RANDOM_MANUAL) && SoundRandomShouldPlay(uiCount))
00756                   fRandomSoundWasCreated |= SoundStartRandom(uiCount);
00757       }
00758 
00759       return(fRandomSoundWasCreated);
00760 }
00761 
00762 //*******************************************************************************
00763 // SoundRandomShouldPlay
00764 //
00765 //    Determines whether a random sound is ready for playing or not.
00766 // 
00767 //    Returns:    TRUE if a the sample should be played.
00768 //
00769 //*******************************************************************************
00770 BOOLEAN SoundRandomShouldPlay(UINT32 uiSample)
00771 {
00772       if(pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags&SAMPLE_RANDOM)
00773             if(pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeNext <= GetTickCount())
00774                   if(pSampleList[uiSample].uiInstances < pSampleList[uiSample].uiMaxInstances)
00775             {
00776                         return(TRUE);
00777             }
00778 
00779       return(FALSE);
00780 }
00781 
00782 //*******************************************************************************
00783 // SoundStartRandom
00784 //
00785 //    Starts an instance of a random sample.
00786 // 
00787 //    Returns:    TRUE if a new random sound was created, FALSE if nothing was done.
00788 //
00789 //*******************************************************************************
00790 UINT32 SoundStartRandom(UINT32 uiSample)
00791 {
00792 UINT32 uiChannel, uiSoundID;
00793 SOUNDPARMS spParms;
00794 
00795     if((uiChannel=SoundGetFreeChannel())!=SOUND_ERROR)
00796       {
00797             memset(&spParms, 0xff, sizeof(SOUNDPARMS));
00798 
00799             spParms.uiVolume=pSampleList[uiSample].uiVolMin+Random(pSampleList[uiSample].uiVolMax-pSampleList[uiSample].uiVolMin);
00800             spParms.uiPan=pSampleList[uiSample].uiPanMin+Random(pSampleList[uiSample].uiPanMax-pSampleList[uiSample].uiPanMin);
00801             spParms.uiLoop=1;
00802             spParms.uiPriority=pSampleList[uiSample].uiPriority;
00803 
00804             if((uiSoundID=SoundStartSample(uiSample, uiChannel, &spParms))!=SOUND_ERROR)
00805             {
00806                   pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeNext=GetTickCount()+pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeMin+Random(pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeMax-pSampleList[uiSample].uiTimeMin);
00807                   pSampleList[uiSample].uiInstances++;
00808                   //SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  SoundPlayRandom():  Sample #%d = '%s'", uiSample, pFilename ) );
00809                   return(TRUE);
00810             }
00811         else
00812             SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  ERROR in SoundStartRandom(): Sample #%d start error - %s", uiSample, FMOD_ErrorString(FSOUND_GetError())));
00813       }
00814     else
00815         SoundLog("  ERROR in SoundStartRandom(): Failed to get free channel");
00816       return(FALSE);
00817 }
00818 
00819 //*******************************************************************************
00820 // SoundStopAllRandom
00821 //
00822 //          This function should be polled by the application if random samples are
00823 //    used. The time marks on each are checked and if it is time to spawn a new
00824 //    instance of the sound, the number already in existance are checked, and if
00825 //    there is room, a new one is made and the count updated. 
00826 //          If random samples are not being used, there is no purpose in polling this
00827 //    function.
00828 // 
00829 //    Returns:    TRUE if a new random sound was created, FALSE if nothing was done.
00830 //
00831 //*******************************************************************************
00832 BOOLEAN SoundStopAllRandom(void)
00833 {
00834 UINT32 uiChannel, uiSample;
00835 
00836       // Stop all currently playing random sounds
00837       for(uiChannel=0; uiChannel < SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS; uiChannel++)
00838       {
00839         if( pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream!=NULL )
00840             {
00841                   uiSample=pSoundList[uiChannel].uiSample;
00842                   
00843                   // if this was a random sample, decrease the iteration count
00844                   if ( (uiSample != -1) && (pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags&SAMPLE_RANDOM) )
00845                         SoundStopIndex(uiChannel);
00846             }
00847       }
00848 
00849       // Unlock all random sounds so they can be dumped from the cache, and
00850       // take the random flag off so they won't be serviced/played
00851       for(uiSample=0; uiSample < SOUND_MAX_CACHED; uiSample++)
00852       {
00853             if(pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags & SAMPLE_RANDOM)
00854                   pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags &= (~(SAMPLE_RANDOM | SAMPLE_LOCKED));
00855       }
00856                   
00857       return(TRUE);
00858 }
00859 
00860 //*******************************************************************************
00861 // SoundServiceStreams
00862 //
00863 //          Can be polled in tight loops where sound buffers might starve due to heavy
00864 //    hardware use, etc. Streams DO NOT normally need to be serviced manually, but
00865 //    in some cases (heavy file loading) it might be desirable.
00866 //
00867 //          If you are using the end of sample callbacks, you must call this function
00868 //    periodically to check the sample's status.
00869 // 
00870 //    Returns:    TRUE always.
00871 //
00872 //*******************************************************************************
00873 BOOLEAN SoundServiceStreams(void)
00874 {
00875 UINT32 uiCount;
00876 
00877     if(fSoundSystemInit)
00878       {
00879             for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS; uiCount++)
00880             {
00881             if( (pSoundList[uiCount].hStream!=NULL) && (pSoundList[uiCount].uiSample==-1) )
00882                   {
00883                         // If a sound has a handle, but isn't playing, stop it and free up the handle
00884                         if(!SoundIsPlaying(pSoundList[uiCount].uiSoundID))
00885                 {
00886                               SoundStopIndex(uiCount);
00887                 }
00888                         else
00889                         { // Check the volume fades on currently playing sounds
00890                               UINT32 uiVolume = SoundGetVolumeIndex(uiCount);
00891                               UINT32 uiTime = GetTickCount();
00892 
00893                               if((uiVolume != pSoundList[uiCount].uiFadeVolume) && (uiTime >= (pSoundList[uiCount].uiFadeTime + pSoundList[uiCount].uiFadeRate)) )
00894                               {
00895                                     if(uiVolume < pSoundList[uiCount].uiFadeVolume)
00896                                           SoundSetVolumeIndex(uiCount, ++uiVolume);
00897                                     else if(uiVolume > pSoundList[uiCount].uiFadeVolume)
00898                                     {
00899                                           uiVolume--;
00900                                           if(!uiVolume && pSoundList[uiCount].fStopAtZero)
00901                             {
00902                                                 SoundStopIndex(uiCount);
00903                                 SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  SoundServiceStreams(): Stop at zero volume on channel %d", uiCount));
00904                             }
00905                                           else
00906                                                 SoundSetVolumeIndex(uiCount, uiVolume);
00907                                     }
00908 
00909                                     pSoundList[uiCount].uiFadeTime = uiTime;
00910                               }
00911                         }
00912                   }
00913             }
00914       }
00915 
00916       return(TRUE);
00917 }
00918 
00919 
00920 //*******************************************************************************
00921 // SoundGetPosition
00922 //
00923 //    Reports the current time position of the sample. 
00924 //
00925 //    Note: You should be checking SoundIsPlaying very carefully while
00926 //    calling this function.
00927 //
00928 //    Returns:    The current time of the sample in milliseconds.
00929 //
00930 //*******************************************************************************
00931 UINT32 SoundGetPosition(UINT32 uiSoundID)
00932 {
00933 UINT32 uiSound, uiTime, uiPosition;
00934 
00935       if(fSoundSystemInit)
00936       {
00937             if((uiSound=SoundGetIndexByID(uiSoundID))!=NO_SAMPLE)
00938             {
00939                   uiTime=GetTickCount();
00940                   // check for rollover
00941                   if(uiTime < pSoundList[uiSound].uiTimeStamp)
00942                         uiPosition=(0-pSoundList[uiSound].uiTimeStamp)+uiTime;
00943                   else
00944                         uiPosition=(uiTime-pSoundList[uiSound].uiTimeStamp);
00945 
00946                   return(uiPosition);
00947             }
00948     }
00949       return(0);
00950 }
00951 
00952 
00953 //*******************************************************************************
00954 // Cacheing Subsystem
00955 //*******************************************************************************
00956 
00957 //*******************************************************************************
00958 // SoundInitCache
00959 //
00960 //          Zeros out the structures of the sample list.
00961 //
00962 //*******************************************************************************
00963 BOOLEAN SoundInitCache(void)
00964 {
00965     UINT32 uiCount;
00966 
00967     SoundLog("Init cache...");
00968     SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  Using %d cache slots", SOUND_MAX_CACHED));
00969 
00970       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CACHED; uiCount++)
00971     {
00972             memset(&pSampleList[uiCount], 0, sizeof(SAMPLETAG));
00973     }
00974 
00975       return(TRUE);
00976 }
00977 
00978 //*******************************************************************************
00979 // SoundShutdownCache
00980 //
00981 //          Empties out the cache.
00982 //
00983 //    Returns: TRUE, always
00984 //
00985 //*******************************************************************************
00986 BOOLEAN SoundShutdownCache(void)
00987 {
00988       SoundEmptyCache();
00989     SoundLog("Cache shutdown");
00990       return(TRUE);
00991 }
00992 
00993 //*******************************************************************************
00994 // SoundSetCacheThreshold
00995 //
00996 //          Sets the sound size above which samples will be played double-buffered, 
00997 // below which they will be loaded into the cache.
00998 //
00999 //    Returns: TRUE, always
01000 //
01001 //*******************************************************************************
01002 BOOLEAN SoundSetCacheThreshhold(UINT32 uiThreshold)
01003 {
01004       if(uiThreshold==0)
01005             guiSoundCacheThreshold=SOUND_DEFAULT_THRESH;
01006       else
01007             guiSoundCacheThreshold=uiThreshold;
01008 
01009       return(TRUE);
01010 }
01011 
01012 //*******************************************************************************
01013 // SoundEmptyCache
01014 //
01015 //          Frees up all samples in the cache.
01016 // 
01017 //    Returns: TRUE, always
01018 //
01019 //*******************************************************************************
01020 BOOLEAN SoundEmptyCache(void)
01021 {
01022 UINT32 uiCount;
01023 
01024     SoundLog("Cleaning cache");
01025       SoundStopAll();
01026 
01027       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CACHED; uiCount++)
01028             SoundFreeSampleIndex(uiCount);
01029 
01030       return(TRUE);
01031 }
01032 
01033 
01034 //*******************************************************************************
01035 // SoundLoadSample
01036 //
01037 //          Loads a sample into cache.
01038 // 
01039 //    Returns: Sample index, if OK. NO_SAMPLE - if error.
01040 //
01041 //*******************************************************************************
01042 UINT32 SoundLoadSample(STR pFilename)
01043 {
01044 UINT32 uiSample=NO_SAMPLE;
01045 
01046       if((uiSample=SoundGetCached(pFilename))!=NO_SAMPLE)
01047             return(uiSample);
01048 
01049       return(SoundLoadDisk(pFilename));
01050 }
01051 
01052 //*******************************************************************************
01053 // SoundLockSample
01054 //
01055 //          Locks a sample into cache memory, so the cacheing system won't release it
01056 //    when it needs room.
01057 // 
01058 //    Returns: The sample index if successful, NO_SAMPLE if the file wasn't found
01059 //                                  in the cache.
01060 //
01061 //*******************************************************************************
01062 UINT32 SoundLockSample(STR pFilename)
01063 {
01064 UINT32 uiSample;
01065 
01066       if((uiSample=SoundGetCached(pFilename))!=NO_SAMPLE)
01067       {
01068             pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags|=SAMPLE_LOCKED;
01069             return(uiSample);
01070       }
01071 
01072       return(NO_SAMPLE);
01073 }
01074 
01075 //*******************************************************************************
01076 // SoundUnlockSample
01077 //
01078 //          Removes the lock on a sample so the cache is free to dump it when necessary.
01079 // 
01080 //    Returns: The sample index if successful, NO_SAMPLE if the file wasn't found
01081 //                                  in the cache.
01082 //
01083 //*******************************************************************************
01084 UINT32 SoundUnlockSample(STR pFilename)
01085 {
01086 UINT32 uiSample;
01087 
01088       if((uiSample=SoundGetCached(pFilename))!=NO_SAMPLE)
01089       {
01090             pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags&=(~SAMPLE_LOCKED);
01091             return(uiSample);
01092       }
01093 
01094       return(NO_SAMPLE);
01095 }
01096 
01097 //*******************************************************************************
01098 // SoundFreeSample
01099 //
01100 //          Releases the resources associated with a sample from the cache.
01101 // 
01102 //    Returns: The sample index if successful, NO_SAMPLE if the file wasn't found
01103 //                                  in the cache.
01104 //
01105 //*******************************************************************************
01106 UINT32 SoundFreeSample(STR pFilename)
01107 {
01108 UINT32 uiSample;
01109 
01110       if((uiSample=SoundGetCached(pFilename))!=NO_SAMPLE)
01111       {
01112             if(!SoundSampleIsPlaying(uiSample))
01113             {
01114                   SoundFreeSampleIndex(uiSample);
01115                   return(uiSample);
01116             }
01117       }
01118       
01119       return(NO_SAMPLE);
01120 }
01121 
01122 //*******************************************************************************
01123 // SoundGetCached
01124 //
01125 //          Tries to locate a sound by looking at what is currently loaded in the
01126 //    cache.
01127 // 
01128 //    Returns: The sample index if successful, NO_SAMPLE if the file wasn't found
01129 //                                  in the cache.
01130 //
01131 //*******************************************************************************
01132 UINT32 SoundGetCached(STR pFilename)
01133 {
01134 UINT32 uiCount;
01135 
01136       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CACHED; uiCount++)
01137       {
01138             if(_stricmp(pSampleList[uiCount].pName, pFilename)==0)
01139                   return(uiCount);
01140       }
01141       
01142       return(NO_SAMPLE);
01143 }
01144 
01145 //*******************************************************************************
01146 // SoundLoadDisk
01147 //
01148 //          Loads a sound file from disk into the cache, allocating memory and a slot
01149 //    for storage.      
01150 //    
01151 // 
01152 //    Returns: The sample index if successful, NO_SAMPLE if the file wasn't found
01153 //                                  in the cache.
01154 //
01155 //*******************************************************************************
01156 UINT32 SoundLoadDisk(STR pFilename)
01157 {
01158 HWFILE      hFile;
01159 UINT32      uiSize, uiSample;
01160 BOOLEAN fRemoved;
01161 
01162       if((hFile=FileOpen(pFilename, FILE_ACCESS_READ, FALSE))!=0)
01163       {
01164             uiSize=FileGetSize(hFile);
01165             
01166             // if insufficient memory, start unloading old samples until either
01167             // there's nothing left to unload, or we fit
01168             fRemoved=TRUE;
01169             while(((uiSize + guiSoundMemoryUsed) > guiSoundMemoryLimit) && (fRemoved))
01170                   fRemoved=SoundCleanCache();
01171 
01172             // if we still don't fit
01173             if((uiSize + guiSoundMemoryUsed) > guiSoundMemoryLimit)
01174             {
01175                   SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  ERROR in SoundLoadDisk():  trying to play '%s', not enough memory", pFilename ) );
01176                   FileClose(hFile);
01177                   return(NO_SAMPLE);
01178             }
01179 
01180             // if all the sample slots are full, unloading one
01181             if((uiSample=SoundGetEmptySample())==NO_SAMPLE)
01182             {
01183                   SoundCleanCache();
01184                   uiSample=SoundGetEmptySample();
01185             }
01186 
01187             // if we still don't have a sample slot
01188             if(uiSample==NO_SAMPLE)
01189             {
01190                   SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  ERROR in SoundLoadDisk(): Trying to play '%s', cache slots are full", pFilename ) );
01191                   FileClose(hFile);
01192                   return(NO_SAMPLE);
01193             }
01194 
01195             memset(&pSampleList[uiSample], 0, sizeof(SAMPLETAG));
01196 
01197             if((pSampleList[uiSample].pData=MemAlloc(uiSize))==NULL)
01198             {
01199                   SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  ERROR in SoundLoadDisk(): Trying to play '%s', memory allocation failed", pFilename ) );
01200                   FileClose(hFile);
01201                   return(NO_SAMPLE);
01202             }
01203 
01204             guiSoundMemoryUsed+=uiSize;
01205 
01206             FileRead(hFile, pSampleList[uiSample].pData, uiSize, NULL);
01207             FileClose(hFile);
01208 
01209             strcpy(pSampleList[uiSample].pName, pFilename);
01210             _strupr(pSampleList[uiSample].pName);
01211             pSampleList[uiSample].uiSize=uiSize;
01212             pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags|=SAMPLE_ALLOCATED;
01213             return(uiSample);
01214       }
01215 
01216     else
01217     {
01218         SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  ERROR in SoundLoadDisk(): Failed to open '%s'", pFilename));
01219     }
01220       return(NO_SAMPLE);
01221 }
01222 
01223 
01224 //*******************************************************************************
01225 // SoundCleanCache
01226 //
01227 //          Removes the least-used sound from the cache to make room.
01228 // 
01229 //    Returns:    TRUE if a sample was freed, FALSE if none 
01230 //
01231 //*******************************************************************************
01232 BOOLEAN SoundCleanCache(void)
01233 {
01234 UINT32 uiCount, uiLowestHits=NO_SAMPLE, uiLowestHitsCount=0;
01235 
01236       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CACHED; uiCount++)
01237       {
01238             if((pSampleList[uiCount].uiFlags&SAMPLE_ALLOCATED) &&
01239                   !(pSampleList[uiCount].uiFlags&SAMPLE_LOCKED))
01240             {
01241                   if((uiLowestHits==NO_SAMPLE) || (uiLowestHitsCount < pSampleList[uiCount].uiCacheHits))
01242                   {
01243                         if(!SoundSampleIsPlaying(uiCount))
01244                         {
01245                               uiLowestHits=uiCount;
01246                               uiLowestHitsCount=pSampleList[uiCount].uiCacheHits;
01247                         }
01248                   }
01249             }
01250       }
01251 
01252     if(uiLowestHits!=NO_SAMPLE)
01253       {
01254             SoundFreeSampleIndex(uiLowestHits);
01255             return(TRUE);
01256       }
01257 
01258       return(FALSE);
01259 }
01260 
01261 //*******************************************************************************
01262 // Low Level Interface (Local use only)
01263 //*******************************************************************************
01264 
01265 //*******************************************************************************
01266 // SoundSampleIsPlaying
01267 //
01268 //          Returns TRUE/FALSE that a sample is currently in use for playing a sound.
01269 //
01270 //*******************************************************************************
01271 BOOLEAN SoundSampleIsPlaying(UINT32 uiSample)
01272 {
01273 UINT32 uiCount;
01274 
01275       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS; uiCount++)
01276       {
01277             if(pSoundList[uiCount].uiSample==uiSample)
01278                   return(TRUE);
01279       }
01280 
01281       return(FALSE);
01282 }
01283 
01284 //*******************************************************************************
01285 // SoundGetEmptySample
01286 //
01287 //          Returns the slot number of an available sample index.
01288 // 
01289 //    Returns:    A free sample index, or NO_SAMPLE if none are left.
01290 //
01291 //*******************************************************************************
01292 UINT32 SoundGetEmptySample(void)
01293 {
01294 UINT32 uiCount;
01295 
01296       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CACHED; uiCount++)
01297       {
01298             if(!(pSampleList[uiCount].uiFlags&SAMPLE_ALLOCATED))
01299                   return(uiCount);
01300       }
01301 
01302       return(NO_SAMPLE);
01303 }
01304 
01305 //*******************************************************************************
01306 // SoundFreeSampleIndex
01307 //
01308 //          Frees up a sample referred to by it's index slot number.    
01309 // 
01310 //    Returns:    Slot number if something was free, NO_SAMPLE otherwise.
01311 //
01312 //*******************************************************************************
01313 UINT32 SoundFreeSampleIndex(UINT32 uiSample)
01314 {
01315       if(pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags&SAMPLE_ALLOCATED)
01316       {
01317             if(pSampleList[uiSample].pData!=NULL)
01318             {
01319                   guiSoundMemoryUsed-=pSampleList[uiSample].uiSize;
01320                   MemFree(pSampleList[uiSample].pData);
01321             }
01322 
01323             memset(&pSampleList[uiSample], 0, sizeof(SAMPLETAG));
01324             return(uiSample);
01325       }
01326       
01327       return(NO_SAMPLE);
01328 }
01329 
01330 //*******************************************************************************
01331 // SoundGetIndexByID
01332 //
01333 //          Searches out a sound instance referred to by it's ID number.
01334 // 
01335 //    Returns:    If the instance was found, the slot number. NO_SAMPLE otherwise.
01336 //
01337 //*******************************************************************************
01338 UINT32 SoundGetIndexByID(UINT32 uiSoundID)
01339 {
01340 UINT32 uiCount;
01341 
01342       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS; uiCount++)
01343       {
01344             if(pSoundList[uiCount].uiSoundID==uiSoundID)
01345                   return(uiCount);
01346       }
01347 
01348       return(NO_SAMPLE);
01349 }
01350 
01351 //*******************************************************************************
01352 // SoundInitHardware
01353 //
01354 //          Initializes the sound hardware through Windows/DirectX. THe highest possible
01355 //    mixing rate and capabilities set are searched out and used.
01356 // 
01357 //    Returns:    TRUE if the hardware was initialized, FALSE otherwise.
01358 //
01359 //*******************************************************************************
01360 BOOLEAN SoundInitHardware(void)
01361 {
01362     SoundLog("Init hardware...");
01363 
01364       // Try to start up the FMOD Sound System
01365     FSOUND_SetOutput(FSOUND_OUTPUT_DSOUND);
01366     FSOUND_SetBufferSize(AUDIO_BUFFER_LEN);
01367       if( !FSOUND_Init(44100, SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS, FSOUND_INIT_GLOBALFOCUS|FSOUND_INIT_DONTLATENCYADJUST) )
01368     {
01369         SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  ERROR in SoundInitHardware(): %s", FMOD_ErrorString(FSOUND_GetError())));
01370             return(FALSE);
01371     }
01372 
01373     SoundLog("  FMOD started");
01374     SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  Using DirectSound driver: %s", FSOUND_GetDriverName(FSOUND_GetDriver())));
01375     SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String("  Mixing rate: %d", FSOUND_GetOutputRate()));
01376 
01377       // Driver is ready
01378       hSoundDriver = TRUE;
01379       fDirectSound = TRUE;
01380 
01381     return(hSoundDriver);
01382 }
01383 
01384 //*******************************************************************************
01385 // SoundShutdownHardware
01386 //
01387 //          Shuts down the system hardware.     
01388 // 
01389 //    Returns:    TRUE always.
01390 //
01391 //*******************************************************************************
01392 BOOLEAN SoundShutdownHardware(void)
01393 {
01394       if(fSoundSystemInit)
01395             FSOUND_Close();
01396     
01397     SoundLog("  FMOD closed");
01398       return(TRUE);
01399 }
01400 
01401 //*******************************************************************************
01402 // SoundGetFreeChannel
01403 //
01404 //          Finds an unused sound channel in the channel list.
01405 // 
01406 //    Returns:    Index of a sound channel if one was found, SOUND_ERROR if not.
01407 //
01408 //*******************************************************************************
01409 UINT32 SoundGetFreeChannel(void)
01410 {
01411 UINT32 uiCount;
01412 
01413       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS; uiCount++)
01414       {
01415             if(!SoundIsPlaying(pSoundList[uiCount].uiSoundID))
01416             {
01417                   SoundStopIndex(uiCount);
01418             }
01419 
01420             if( pSoundList[uiCount].hStream==NULL )
01421                   return(uiCount);
01422       }
01423 
01424       return(SOUND_ERROR);    
01425 }
01426 
01427 //*******************************************************************************
01428 // SoundStartSample
01429 //
01430 //          Starts up a sample on the specified channel. Override parameters are passed
01431 //    in through the structure pointer pParms. Any entry with a value of 0xffffffff
01432 //    will be filled in by the system.
01433 // 
01434 //    Returns:    Unique sound ID if successful, SOUND_ERROR if not.
01435 //
01436 //*******************************************************************************
01437 UINT32 SoundStartSample(UINT32 uiSample, UINT32 uiChannel, SOUNDPARMS *pParms)
01438 {
01439 UINT32 uiSoundID;
01440 
01441     if(!fSoundSystemInit)
01442             return(SOUND_ERROR);
01443 
01444     // Setting up stream buffer
01445     FSOUND_Stream_SetBufferSize(STREAM_BUFFER_LEN);
01446 
01447     // Creating stream
01448     pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream=FSOUND_Stream_Open((char *)pSampleList[uiSample].pData, FSOUND_LOADMEMORY|FSOUND_LOOP_NORMAL|FSOUND_2D, 0, pSampleList[uiSample].uiSize);
01449       if(pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream==NULL)
01450       {
01451         SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String(" ERROR in SoundStartSample(): %s", FMOD_ErrorString(FSOUND_GetError()) ));
01452             return(SOUND_ERROR);
01453       }
01454 
01455     // Setup sample params
01456     // Loop
01457       if((pParms!=NULL) && (pParms->uiLoop!=SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT))
01458       {
01459             // If looping infinately, lock the sample so it can't be unloaded
01460             // and mark it as a looping sound
01461             if(pParms->uiLoop==0)
01462             {
01463                   pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags|=SAMPLE_LOCKED;
01464                   pSoundList[uiChannel].fLooping=TRUE;
01465             }
01466         else
01467             FSOUND_Stream_SetLoopCount(pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream, pParms->uiLoop-1);
01468       }
01469 
01470     // Starting stream in pause
01471     pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel = FSOUND_Stream_PlayEx(uiChannel, pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream, NULL, TRUE);
01472     if(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel==-1)
01473     {
01474         FSOUND_Stream_Close(pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream);
01475         SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String(" ERROR in SoundStartSample(): %s", FMOD_ErrorString(FSOUND_GetError()) ));
01476             return(SOUND_ERROR);
01477     }
01478 
01479       // Speed and pitchbend don't use
01480 
01481     // Volume
01482       if((pParms!=NULL) && (pParms->uiVolume!=SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT))
01483             FSOUND_SetVolume(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel, pParms->uiVolume * 2);
01484       else
01485             FSOUND_SetVolume(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel, guiSoundDefaultVolume);
01486 
01487     // Panning
01488       if((pParms!=NULL) && (pParms->uiPan!=SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT))
01489             FSOUND_SetPan(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel, pParms->uiPan);
01490     else
01491         FSOUND_SetPan(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel, 128);
01492 
01493     // Start sound!
01494     FSOUND_SetPaused(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel, FALSE);
01495 
01496     // Priority
01497       if((pParms!=NULL) && (pParms->uiPriority!=SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT))
01498             pSoundList[uiChannel].uiPriority=pParms->uiPriority;
01499       else
01500             pSoundList[uiChannel].uiPriority=PRIORITY_MAX;
01501 
01502     // Callback at end of playback
01503       if((pParms!=NULL) && ((UINT32)pParms->EOSCallback!=SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT))
01504       {
01505             pSoundList[uiChannel].EOSCallback=pParms->EOSCallback;
01506             pSoundList[uiChannel].pCallbackData=pParms->pCallbackData;
01507       }
01508       else
01509       {
01510             pSoundList[uiChannel].EOSCallback=NULL;
01511             pSoundList[uiChannel].pCallbackData=NULL;
01512       }
01513             
01514     // Other stuff...
01515       uiSoundID=SoundGetUniqueID();
01516       pSoundList[uiChannel].uiSoundID=uiSoundID;
01517       pSoundList[uiChannel].uiSample=uiSample;
01518       pSoundList[uiChannel].uiTimeStamp=GetTickCount();
01519       pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFadeVolume = SoundGetVolumeIndex(uiChannel);
01520       
01521       pSampleList[uiSample].uiCacheHits++;
01522 
01523       return(uiSoundID);
01524 }
01525 
01526 //*******************************************************************************
01527 // SoundStartStream
01528 //
01529 //          Starts up a stream on the specified channel. Override parameters are passed
01530 //    in through the structure pointer pParms. Any entry with a value of 0xffffffff
01531 //    will be filled in by the system.
01532 // 
01533 //    Returns:    Unique sound ID if successful, SOUND_ERROR if not.
01534 //
01535 //*******************************************************************************
01536 UINT32 SoundStartStream(STR pFilename, UINT32 uiChannel, SOUNDPARMS *pParms)
01537 {
01538 UINT32 uiSoundID;
01539 
01540       if(!fSoundSystemInit)
01541             return(SOUND_ERROR);
01542 
01543     // Setting up stream buffer
01544     FSOUND_Stream_SetBufferSize(STREAM_BUFFER_LEN);
01545 
01546     // Creating stream
01547       pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream=FSOUND_Stream_Open(pFilename, FSOUND_LOOP_NORMAL|FSOUND_2D, 0, 0);
01548       if(pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream==NULL)
01549       {
01550         SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String(" ERROR in SoundStartStream(): %s ('%s')", FMOD_ErrorString(FSOUND_GetError()), pFilename));
01551             return(SOUND_ERROR);
01552       }
01553       
01554     // Setup params
01555     // Loop
01556       if( (pParms!=NULL) && (pParms->uiLoop!=SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT ) )
01557       {
01558             if(pParms->uiLoop>0)
01559             FSOUND_Stream_SetLoopCount(pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream, pParms->uiLoop-1);
01560     }
01561 
01562     // Starting stream in pause
01563     pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel = FSOUND_Stream_PlayEx(uiChannel, pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream, NULL, TRUE);
01564     if(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel==-1)
01565     {
01566         FSOUND_Stream_Close(pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream);
01567         SoundLog((CHAR8 *)String(" ERROR in SoundStartStream(): %s ('%s')", FMOD_ErrorString(FSOUND_GetError()), pFilename));
01568             return(SOUND_ERROR);
01569     }
01570 
01571     // Speed and pitchbend don't use
01572 
01573     // Volume
01574       if((pParms!=NULL) && (pParms->uiVolume!=SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT))
01575             FSOUND_SetVolume(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel, pParms->uiVolume * 2);
01576       else
01577             FSOUND_SetVolume(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel, guiSoundDefaultVolume);
01578 
01579     // Panning
01580       if((pParms!=NULL) && (pParms->uiPan!=SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT))
01581             FSOUND_SetPan(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel, pParms->uiPan);
01582 
01583     // Start sound!
01584       FSOUND_SetPaused(pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFMODChannel, FALSE);
01585 
01586     // Get ID
01587       uiSoundID=SoundGetUniqueID();
01588       pSoundList[uiChannel].uiSoundID=uiSoundID;
01589 
01590     // Priority
01591       if(pParms)
01592             pSoundList[uiChannel].uiPriority=pParms->uiPriority;
01593       else
01594             pSoundList[uiChannel].uiPriority=SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT;
01595 
01596     // Callback at end of playback
01597       if((pParms!=NULL) && ((UINT32)pParms->EOSCallback!=SOUND_PARMS_DEFAULT))
01598       {
01599             pSoundList[uiChannel].EOSCallback=pParms->EOSCallback;
01600             pSoundList[uiChannel].pCallbackData=pParms->pCallbackData;
01601       }
01602       else
01603       {
01604             pSoundList[uiChannel].EOSCallback=NULL;
01605             pSoundList[uiChannel].pCallbackData=NULL;
01606       }
01607 
01608     // Other stuff
01609       pSoundList[uiChannel].uiTimeStamp=GetTickCount();
01610       pSoundList[uiChannel].uiFadeVolume = SoundGetVolumeIndex(uiChannel);
01611     pSoundList[uiChannel].uiSample = -1;    // it's streaming directly from file !!!!
01612 
01613     return(uiSoundID);
01614 }

01619 static void * F_CALLBACKAPI SoundFileOpen(const CHAR8 *pName)
01620 {
01621     return((void*)FileOpen((STR)pName, FILE_ACCESS_READ | FILE_OPEN_EXISTING, FALSE));
01622 }
01623 
01624 static void F_CALLBACKAPI SoundFileClose(void *uiHandle)
01625 {
01626     FileClose((UINT32)uiHandle);
01627 }
01628 
01629 static INT F_CALLBACKAPI SoundFileRead(void *pBuffer, INT iSize, void *uiHandle)
01630 {
01631     UINT32 uiActuallyRead;
01632 
01633     FileRead((UINT32)uiHandle, pBuffer, iSize, &uiActuallyRead);
01634     return(uiActuallyRead);
01635 }
01636 
01637 static INT F_CALLBACKAPI SoundFileSeek(void *uiHandle, INT iPos, signed char cMode)
01638 {
01639     UINT8   uiHow;
01640 
01641     switch(cMode)
01642     {
01643     case SEEK_END:
01644         uiHow = FILE_SEEK_FROM_END;
01645         break;
01646     case SEEK_CUR:
01647         uiHow = FILE_SEEK_FROM_CURRENT;
01648         break;
01649     default:
01650         uiHow = FILE_SEEK_FROM_START;
01651     }
01652 
01653     return(!FileSeek((UINT32)uiHandle, iPos, uiHow));
01654 }
01655 
01656 static INT F_CALLBACKAPI SoundFileTell(void *uiHandle)
01657 {
01658     return(FileGetPos((UINT32)uiHandle));
01659 }

01661 //*******************************************************************************
01662 // SoundGetUniqueID
01663 //
01664 //          Returns a unique ID number with every call. Basically it's just a 32-bit
01665 // static value that is incremented each time.
01666 //
01667 //*******************************************************************************
01668 UINT32 SoundGetUniqueID(void)
01669 {
01670 static UINT32 uiNextID=0;
01671 
01672       if(uiNextID==NO_SAMPLE)
01673             uiNextID++;
01674 
01675       return(uiNextID++);
01676 }
01677 
01678 //*******************************************************************************
01679 // SoundPlayStreamed
01680 //
01681 //          Returns TRUE/FALSE whether a sound file should be played as a streamed
01682 //    sample, or loaded into the cache. The decision is based on the size of the
01683 //    file compared to the guiSoundCacheThreshold.
01684 // 
01685 //    Returns:    TRUE if it should be streamed, FALSE if loaded.
01686 //
01687 //*******************************************************************************
01688 BOOLEAN SoundPlayStreamed(STR pFilename)
01689 {
01690 HWFILE hDisk;
01691 UINT32 uiFilesize;
01692 
01693       if((hDisk=FileOpen(pFilename, FILE_ACCESS_READ, FALSE))!=0)
01694       {
01695             uiFilesize=FileGetSize(hDisk);
01696             FileClose(hDisk);
01697             return(uiFilesize >= guiSoundCacheThreshold);
01698       }
01699 
01700       return(FALSE);
01701 }
01702 
01703 //*******************************************************************************
01704 // SoundStopIndex
01705 //
01706 //          Stops a sound referred to by it's slot number. This function is the only
01707 //    one that should be deallocating sample handles. The random sounds have to have
01708 //    their counters maintained, and using this as the central function ensures
01709 //    that they stay in sync.
01710 // 
01711 //    Returns:    TRUE if the sample was stopped, FALSE if it could not be found.
01712 //
01713 //*******************************************************************************
01714 BOOLEAN SoundStopIndex(UINT32 uiChannel)
01715 {
01716 UINT32 uiSample;
01717 
01718       if(fSoundSystemInit)
01719       {
01720             if(uiChannel!=NO_SAMPLE)
01721             {
01722                   if(pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream!=NULL)
01723                   {
01724                         FSOUND_Stream_Stop(pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream);
01725                 FSOUND_Stream_Close(pSoundList[uiChannel].hStream);
01726 
01727                       uiSample=pSoundList[uiChannel].uiSample;
01728 
01729                 // if this was a random sample, decrease the iteration count
01730                         if ( (uiSample != -1) && (pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags&SAMPLE_RANDOM) )
01731                               pSampleList[uiSample].uiInstances--;
01732 
01733                 if(pSoundList[uiChannel].EOSCallback!=NULL)
01734                               pSoundList[uiChannel].EOSCallback(pSoundList[uiChannel].pCallbackData);
01735 
01736                 if(!pSoundList[uiChannel].fLooping && !SoundSampleIsInUse(uiChannel))
01737                               SoundRemoveSampleFlags(uiSample, SAMPLE_LOCKED);
01738 
01739                 memset(&pSoundList[uiChannel], 0, sizeof(SOUNDTAG));
01740                   }
01741             
01742                   return(TRUE);
01743             }
01744       }
01745 
01746       return(FALSE);
01747 }
01748 
01749 // FUNCTIONS TO SET / RESET SAMPLE FLAGS
01750 void SoundSetSampleFlags( UINT32 uiSample, UINT32 uiFlags )
01751 {
01752       // CHECK FOR VALUE SAMPLE
01753       if((pSampleList[ uiSample ].uiFlags&SAMPLE_ALLOCATED) )
01754       {
01755             // SET
01756             pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags |= uiFlags;
01757       }
01758 }
01759 
01760 void SoundRemoveSampleFlags( UINT32 uiSample, UINT32 uiFlags )
01761 {
01762       // CHECK FOR VALID SAMPLE
01763       if((pSampleList[ uiSample ].uiFlags&SAMPLE_ALLOCATED) )
01764       {
01765             //REMOVE
01766             pSampleList[uiSample].uiFlags &= (~uiFlags);
01767       }
01768 }
01769 
01770 //*******************************************************************************
01771 // SoundSampleIsInUse
01772 //
01773 //    Returns:    TRUE if the sample index is currently being played by the system.
01774 //
01775 //*******************************************************************************
01776 BOOLEAN SoundSampleIsInUse(UINT32 uiSample)
01777 {
01778 UINT32 uiCount;
01779 
01780       for(uiCount=0; uiCount < SOUND_MAX_CHANNELS; uiCount++)
01781       {
01782             if((pSoundList[uiCount].uiSample==uiSample) && SoundIsPlaying(uiCount))
01783                   return(TRUE);
01784       }
01785 
01786       return(FALSE);
01787 }

01793 //*****************************************************************************************
01794 // SoundLog
01795 //  Writes string into log file
01796 // 
01797 // Returns nothing 
01798 // 
01799 // Created:  10.12.2005 Lesh
01800 //*****************************************************************************************
01801 void SoundLog(CHAR8 *strMessage)
01802 {
01803       if ((SndDebug = fopen(SndDebugFileName, "a+t")) != NULL)
01804       { 
01805           fprintf(SndDebug, "%s\n", strMessage);
01806             fclose(SndDebug);
01807       }
01808 }

01810 //*****************************************************************************************

01812 //  Creates empty log file
01813 // 
01814 // Returns nothing 
01815 // 
01816 // Created:  10.12.2005 Lesh
01817 //*****************************************************************************************
01818 void InitLogging()
01819 {
01820       if ((SndDebug = fopen(SndDebugFileName, "wt")) != NULL)
01821       { 
01822             fclose(SndDebug);
01823       }
01824 }
